(1)
East side market at Houston and Allen Streets. A roast potato vendor is shown in the foreground, supplying luncheon to a group of shopping house wives.
April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A fellow competitor.
1923.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Sweet potatoes.

text:
(1) Russian Bread kwas, made of honey and water; a Russian peasants drink, similar to our mead, being sold ice cold, at the corner of First Ave., and Houston Street. June 26, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; another view, showing a street hawker, selling trousers. June 26, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A soft drink peddler on wheels; on York Ave., between 62nd and 63rd Streets. September 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Soft drinks.
